message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.CC

This paper deals with the optimization of virtual function placement in cloud-based radio access networks, which involves network infrastructure, distributed computing, and optimization techniques. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also discusses the use of cloud computing and virtualization, which falls under cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). The optimization problem formulation and heuristic approaches fall under cs.SY (Systems and Control). The paper also discusses the use of statistical multiplexing gains, which is related to cs.IT (Information Theory). Finally, the paper proposes enhancements to the branch-and-bound heuristic, which falls under cs.CC (Computational Complexity).
